title.name: Abberathine Horns
title.flavour text: "As warm as living flesh, and smelling strongly of sulphite.<br>Morbid curiosity compels me to add it to my collection of oddities."

title.name: Admiral Proclar's Pipe
title.flavour text: "Admiral Proclar wreaked havoc on my smuggling routes for two full decades. Now that he's dead, <br>it's a matter of thieves' honour to check whether my product was in his pipe."

title.name: Alchemical Chalice
title.flavour text: "The chalice holds certain properties that make scientists quite possessive and irrational.<br>It's best if you don't ask too many questions about this one."

title.name: Ancient Seal
title.flavour text: "At first glance, this seal seems no more than an ornament. But when one<br>looks closer, one realizes the design is from no culture we yet know of."

title.name: Blood of Innocence
title.flavour text: "In the early days of his religion, Innocence told his followers to drink of his blood and<br>enjoy eternal life. If that power holds in his ancient ichor, I hope that it can resurrect as well."

title.name: Box of Tripyxis
title.flavour text: "Allegedly turns water to Lethe. That makes it my competition. <br>I don't like competition."

title.name: Bust of Emperor Caspiro
title.flavour text: "Caspiro was a master of presentation. He maintained peace in Wraeclast through displays<br>of strength that, sadly, had no meaning to the dark presence that dismembered him..."

title.name: Celestial Stone
title.flavour text: "This unassuming rock reportedly fell from the sky a few centuries ago. Sounds impossible,<br>but the men who are guarding it obviously believe the tale, so I do, too."

title.name: Ceremonial Goblet
title.flavour text: Ornately adorned and heavier than is practical.

title.name: Crest of Ezomyr
title.flavour text: "A symbol of my birthright and claim to my fiefdom. <br>I must have it if I am to return my family to its rightful place."

title.name: Crested Golden Idol
title.flavour text: A common figure adorning Vaal ruins, but exquisitely crafted from gold.

title.name: Dekhara's Resolve
title.flavour text: "A simple ornament from the days when Keth's trade empire was the<br>glory of the world. Protectors at the massive toll gates wore these."

title.name: Enigmatic Assembly A4
title.flavour text: "I currently possess four-hundred and forty-four pieces of this ancient<br>and puzzling device. A few seem to be missing. This part is crucial."

title.name: Enigmatic Assembly B2
title.flavour text: "There is no telling what this device may do when completed, but I<br>have made it my life's work. There must be a deeper meaning!"

title.name: Enigmatic Assembly C5
title.flavour text: "I have spent my family's entire fortune in the pursuit of this device.<br>Assembling it and turning it on is all I have left."

title.name: Enigmatic Assembly D1
title.flavour text: "My schematics are clear. Once the Enigmatic Assembly is complete, it<br>will be a weapon to rival the gods! It must be... it has to be..."

title.name: Essence Burner
title.flavour text: "Trust in scientists to create tools for better drug distillation. They don't know the<br>worth of the beautiful tools they have. Let's make sure it stays that way."

title.name: Ez Myrae Tome
title.flavour text: "A true curiosity. Matches no known language, yet its illustrations hint at knowledge <br>only rediscovered hundreds of years after the death of its unknown author."

title.name: Flask of Welakath
title.flavour text: "Long ago, a traitor was promised this mythical elixir. We consider her a fool for<br>believing it exists, but if it does... I would certainly like to take a sip and find out."

title.name: Forbidden Lamp
title.flavour text: "The lamp is said to contain Aziza, the Fourth Servant of Water. I doubt the tale<br>is true, but I cannot allow one of our artifacts to fall into Kondor's hands."

title.name: Golden Ceremonial Mask
title.flavour text: The last shimmering face witnessed by many a sacrifice.

title.name: Golden Grotesque
title.flavour text: At once horrid and beautiful, awkward and alluring, silly and overwhelmingly mysterious.

title.name: Golden Hetzapal Idol
title.flavour text: "I found the tomb in the first place, and they had the nerve to empty it without me! <br>Reckon it'll make a fine trophy for my efforts."

title.name: Golden Matatl Idol
title.flavour text: "One must, as one should, admire the lasting works of those who came before.<br>The Vaal were the uncontested greatest architects until we,<br>and Matatl soared above their best."

title.name: Golden Napuatzi Idol
title.flavour text: "I believe she was a beautiful maiden. <br>Kind, virtuous and devout through-and-through.<br>Such a gift will set me apart from all other suitors."

title.name: Golden Prayer Idol
title.flavour text: Silently keeps innumerable secrets whispered in moments of desperation.

title.name: Golden Sacrificial Glyph
title.flavour text: Dried blood remains trapped in its many deep grooves.

title.name: Golden Slave Idol
title.flavour text: "Victims of war, the indebted, and the irredeemably shamed<br>were to live their lives in servitude. Some rose above their station. <br>This individual, it seems, was all but deified."

title.name: Golden Xoplotli Idol
title.flavour text: "Heard if you put a drop of blood in its mouth,<br>it'll whisper the secrets of immortality.<br>Doesn't have to be your own blood, does it?"

title.name: Hand of Arimor
title.flavour text: "Balabus Arimor was a little-known preacher during the days of Emperor Chitus,<br>who believed eternal life could be achieved through ritual sacrifice.<br>We shall see whether he was a prophet - or a charlatan."

title.name: Heart Coil
title.flavour text: "There are very few devices in this world that can act as a heart for a<br>machine. This one is an ancient remnant of the work of Vaal engineers."

title.name: Impossible Crystal
title.flavour text: "The world is governed by certain natural laws. Science and thaumaturgy are one<br>and the same. But the crystal... it shouldn't exist. It's not from here. We must have it."

title.name: Incense of Keth
title.flavour text: "Sap of the Aturi tree, known only to grow at the meeting point of the seven waters.<br>Nothing since its disappearance has smelled as wondrous."

title.name: Living Ice
title.flavour text: "Are we the only ones who understand the danger? The fools! Living ice absorbs heat<br>and grows. We must control it properly, lest it spread across all of Wraeclast."

title.name: Mirror of Teklatipitzi
title.flavour text: "I'll give it to her and tell her<br>'It once held the reflection of a Queen, and now it will once more.'<br>Anton can cross the Vastiri on his family fruits <br>if he thinks he loves her like I do."

title.name: Ogham Candelabra
title.flavour text: "Those Eternal bastards looted everything that wasn't bolted to the floor when we<br>finally drove them from our island! That candelabra belongs with us!"

title.name: Orbala's Fifth Adventure
title.flavour text: "The relief was the first ever depiction of some Maraketh girl named Orbala undertaking her<br>fifth great adventure. I don't particularly care about the story, I just don't want Bazira to have it."

title.name: Seal of Lunaris
title.flavour text: "I have a suspicion that the Maraketh Sekhema of legend, Lundara, is the same historical<br>figure as the Azmeri and Eternal goddess Lunaris. The Seal may prove that."

title.name: Seal of Solaris
title.flavour text: "It is my belief that Solerai, from the Maraketh legend, is Solaris herself in another system of<br>myths. If I can prove that, I can begin piecing together a true history of the Winter of the World."

title.name: Staff of the first Sin Eater
title.flavour text: "The history of the order of Sin Eaters is shrouded in secrecy and shame.<br>Nevertheless, history demands truth, even if it takes centuries to be revealed."

title.name: Sword of the Inverse Relic
title.flavour text: "By all accounts, the Sword of the Inverse Relic was found aged and rusted,<br>but is becoming less weathered over time. We really must study its properties."

title.name: The Goddess of Water
title.flavour text: "The relief depicts some sort of forgotten Maraketh goddess. I have no idea what<br>the context is. The important thing is that you steal it before Bazira does."

title.name: The Golden Ibis
title.flavour text: "It is said that the Golden Ibis was forged before time itself, before writing, or even<br>oral history. That's nonsense, of course, but it's still very old, and therefore noteworthy."

title.name: The Sea Pearl Heirloom
title.flavour text: "My accursed father owes his children this heirloom. We deserve<br>to know our culture, just like you full-blooded humans do."

title.name: Tusked Hominid Skull
title.flavour text: "If the skull is real, and not a forgery, then it may show that my people are not the<br>abominations others believe us to be. The word 'human' may have a broader meaning."

title.name: Urn of Farud
title.flavour text: "The Faridun cannot earn burial in the sky.<br>They have other ways of keeping the dead."

title.name: Urn of the Original Ashes
title.flavour text: "A great fire once swept the land, and our leaders were turned to ash where they stood.<br>The urn contains exactly what you think it does, and serves as proof of our long lineage."
